title.narrative: Special Investigative Unit (SIUB) Advanced Course, Domincan Republic

description.narrative: Special Investigative Unit (SIUB) Advanced Course, Domincan Republic; This course supplements instruction provided during the SIU Basic Course and provides additional instruction on several aspects of conducting a judicial wire intercept investigation. These include undercover operations, advanced operational planning, tactical entries, confidential Source management, and money laundering

sector.narrative: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform

title.narrative: Special Investigative Unit (SIUG) Basic Course, Domincan Republic

description.narrative: Special Investigative Unit (SIUG) Basic Course, Domincan Republic; This is a five week course serves as the foundation in fundamental law enforcement practices for newly assigned officers. It is based on the DEA Basic Agent training program and covers a wide range of topics in drug law enforcement.

title.narrative: Special Investigation Unit (SIU) 7 Formal Vetted Course

description.narrative: Special Investigation Unit (SIU) 7 Formal Vetted Course; A two-week preliminary course provided to vetted units prior to becoming Sensitive Investigative Units (SIU). The training provided assists these officers in working more complex investigations and in the prosecution of international drug trafficking organizations.

title.narrative: Special Investigative Unit (SIU 6) Advanced Course, Dominican Republic

description.narrative: Special Investigative Unit (SIU 6) Advanced Course, Dominican Republic; This one-week advanced training course is designed for SIU commanders responsible for supervising units. The course addresses all core topics from a SIU managers perspective which includes the following; management of SIU, DEA oversight of program, operational planning, critical incident response, risk management, officer safety, leadership, ethics and professionalism in law enforcement, confidential source management, the supervision of enforcement operations, as well as the identification of trends associated with narco-terrorism. The course is conducted via a workshop environment and also encourages SIU commanders and DEA management to exchange information in order to make important decisions needed to improve the SIU program

sector.narrative: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform
